column4: hi I upgraded to 8.04 and now my wireless driver is no longer working. can someone point me in the right direction.
intel 3945
I tried to compile the linux driver which was the iwl driver that I downloaded from intel but the it failed...
it was workign in 7.10
I was using wicd which got upgrade and stopped working
some folks have been hit with a bug with the transition from ipw to iwl
I think that might be the case here from what I've been seeing on the forums but can't verify
how is taht bug resolved?
oddly enough, a fresh install of kde4 had it workining out of the box for me-->perhaps gnome might do the same might try the live cd and check it out
I tried booting off a live cd and it didn't seem like it was working...but my dhcp server was screen and nm-applet seems to have a problem working when you take an adapter off roaming mode
best when in live cd to drop to a shell and see what ifconfig/iwconfig turn up
ok let's say for a second, that it's successful. how does that help me unless I go for a complete reinstall which is not an option right now
clearly not, just lets you know that it is upgrades and not fresh installs that has the bug-->though you could copy your home partition elsewehre and just copy it back
fair enough
so booting from the live cd didn't help...no love with the wifi
that site loads fine here
how do I troubleshoot why this isn't loading for me?
you installed flashplugin-nonfree?
yes I do...
that is odd; is there some other setup you have going that might affect this?
I don't think so...
thanks a restart got it working...I should have tested that before bothering you guys...
nicely done :)
